Recurrent Childhood Craniopharyngioma
				                    Craniopharyngioma may recur (come back) no matter how it was treated the first time. Treatment options for recurrent childhood craniopharyngioma depend on the type of treatment that was given when the tumor was first diagnosed and the needs of the child.    Treatment may include the following:          -  Surgery (resection).    -  External-beam radiation therapy.    -  Stereotactic radiosurge
